text: We’ll hear arguments next in 72-1598, National Labor Relations Board against Bell Aerospace.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
May it please the Court, Mr. Chief Justice.
For how long period?
19 months.
19 months.
In 19 months period the group of 25 together spent $7,600,000.00 on their own initiative.
Well, the company spent it?
Yes, but on their signature.
Alright.
Collectively in the same period, the group of 25 supervised or participated in the procurement of material in the amount of $41,300,000.00.
But in contrary you say you are not talking about light bulbs, you are not talking about this, what are you talking about?
We are talking, Mr. Justice Marshall, we are talking about special components for Minute Man missile.
How many people do they supervise?
They act on their own initiative.
So they don’t supervise anybody?
They are not being exempt as supervisors.
That’s why they are not supervisors.
That’s right.
Are they -- excuse me.
They have it as the proof shows here, the authority to decide to make or buy.
On a, let us say a big item of $100,000.00 or --
But again --
Do they have the make or buy or decision?
They make a recommendation.
-- how about the management decision to make or buy?
They make a recommendation and after the recommendation is reviewed but I am sure Your Honor will know that where the work has been carefully done at that level.
